channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: SUG: Single-dataset Unified Generalization for 3D Point Cloud Classification
item.description: In this paper, different from previous 2D DG works, we focus on the 3D DG problem and propose a Single-dataset Unified Generalization (SUG) framework that only leverages a single source dataset to alleviate the unforeseen domain differences faced by a well-trained source model.

item.title: Large Language Models are Built-in Autoregressive Search Engines
item.description: To overcome this limitation, recent autoregressive search engines replace the dual-encoder architecture by directly generating identifiers for relevant documents in the candidate pool.

item.title: xPQA: Cross-Lingual Product Question Answering across 12 Languages
item.description: To study this practical industrial task, we present xPQA, a large-scale annotated cross-lingual PQA dataset in 12 languages across 9 branches, and report results in (1) candidate ranking, to select the best English candidate containing the information to answer a non-English question; and (2) answer generation, to generate a natural-sounding non-English answer based on the selected English candidate.

item.title: RAMario: Experimental Approach to Reptile Algorithm -- Reinforcement Learning for Mario
item.description: This research paper presents an experimental approach to using the Reptile algorithm for reinforcement learning to train a neural network to play Super Mario Bros. We implement the Reptile algorithm using the Super Mario Bros Gym library and TensorFlow in Python, creating a neural network model with a single convolutional layer, a flatten layer, and a dense layer.

item.title: ContrastNet: A Contrastive Learning Framework for Few-Shot Text Classification
item.description: Few-shot text classification has recently been promoted by the meta-learning paradigm which aims to identify target classes with knowledge transferred from source classes with sets of small tasks named episodes.

item.title: Concurrent Misclassification and Out-of-Distribution Detection for Semantic Segmentation via Energy-Based Normalizing Flow
item.description: FlowEneDet achieves promising results on Cityscapes, Cityscapes-C, FishyScapes and SegmentMeIfYouCan benchmarks in IDM/OOD detection when applied to pretrained DeepLabV3+ and SegFormer semantic segmentation models.

item.title: Establishing Shared Query Understanding in an Open Multi-Agent System
item.description: Furthermore, we demonstrate a use-case where our method can be applied for the task of cooperative query answering.

item.title: Satisfiability-Aided Language Models Using Declarative Prompting
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new satisfiability-aided language modeling approach for improving the reasoning capabilities of LLMs.

item.title: Hybrid and Collaborative Passage Reranking
item.description: In passage retrieval system, the initial passage retrieval results may be unsatisfactory, which can be refined by a reranking scheme.

item.title: OmniSafe: An Infrastructure for Accelerating Safe Reinforcement Learning Research
item.description: AI systems empowered by reinforcement learning (RL) algorithms harbor the immense potential to catalyze societal advancement, yet their deployment is often impeded by significant safety concerns.

item.title: Discrete Diffusion Probabilistic Models for Symbolic Music Generation
item.description: Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models (DDPMs) have made great strides in generating high-quality samples in both discrete and continuous domains.

item.title: Wavelet-based Unsupervised Label-to-Image Translation
item.description: Semantic Image Synthesis (SIS) is a subclass of image-to-image translation where a semantic layout is used to generate a photorealistic image.

item.title: Bidirectional Generative Framework for Cross-domain Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Cross-domain aspect-based sentiment analysis (ABSA) aims to perform various fine-grained sentiment analysis tasks on a target domain by transferring knowledge from a source domain.

item.title: Multi-Level Global Context Cross Consistency Model for Semi-Supervised Ultrasound Image Segmentation with Diffusion Model
item.description: Our approach enables the effective transfer of probability distribution knowledge to the segmentation network, resulting in improved segmentation accuracy.

item.title: On Optimal Strategies for Wordle and General Guessing Games
item.description: The recent popularity of Wordle has revived interest in guessing games.

item.title: Noise robust neural network architecture
item.description: In which we propose neural network architecture (dune neural network) for recognizing general noisy image without adding any artificial noise in the training data.

item.title: An Empirical Study on Google Research Football Multi-agent Scenarios
item.description: Few multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) research on Google Research Football (GRF) focus on the 11v11 multi-agent full-game scenario and to the best of our knowledge, no open benchmark on this scenario has been released to the public.

item.title: MPI-rical: Data-Driven MPI Distributed Parallelism Assistance with Transformers
item.description: Automatic source-to-source parallelization of serial code for shared and distributed memory systems is a challenging task in high-performance computing.

item.title: Dual-Alignment Pre-training for Cross-lingual Sentence Embedding
item.description: Recent studies have shown that dual encoder models trained with the sentence-level translation ranking task are effective methods for cross-lingual sentence embedding.

item.title: Lightweight Self-Knowledge Distillation with Multi-source Information Fusion
item.description: Specifically, we introduce a Distillation with Reverse Guidance (DRG) method that considers different levels of information extracted by the model, including edge, shape, and detail of the input data, to construct a more informative teacher.

item.title: Online Continual Learning Without the Storage Constraint
item.description: Online continual learning (OCL) research has primarily focused on mitigating catastrophic forgetting with fixed and limited storage allocation throughout the agent's lifetime.

item.title: Blind Image Quality Assessment via Transformer Predicted Error Map and Perceptual Quality Token
item.description: Specifically, we firstly generate the predicted error map by pre-training one model consisting of a Transformer encoder and decoder, in which the objective difference between the distorted and the reference images is used as supervision.

item.title: Content-Adaptive Downsampling in Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: Many convolutional neural networks (CNNs) rely on progressive downsampling of their feature maps to increase the network's receptive field and decrease computational cost.

item.title: Multi-view MERA Subspace Clustering
item.description: Benefiting from multiple interactions among orthogonal/semi-orthogonal (low-rank) factors, the low-rank MERA has a strong representation power to capture the complex inter/intra-view information in the self-representation tensor.

item.title: Cross-Modal Global Interaction and Local Alignment for Audio-Visual Speech Recognition
item.description: However, most existing AVSR approaches simply fuse the audio and visual features by concatenation, without explicit interactions to capture the deep correlations between them, which results in sub-optimal multimodal representations for downstream speech recognition task.

item.title: Measuring Implicit Bias Using SHAP Feature Importance and Fuzzy Cognitive Maps
item.description: In this paper, we integrate the concepts of feature importance with implicit bias in the context of pattern classification.

item.title: Progressive Translation: Improving Domain Robustness of Neural Machine Translation with Intermediate Sequences
item.description: Furthermore, we introduce a full-permutation multi-task learning to alleviate the spurious causal relations from intermediate sequences to the target, which results from exposure bias.

item.title: Dynamics of niche construction in adaptable populations evolving in diverse environments
item.description: In this work, we study NC in simulation environments that consist of multiple, diverse niches and populations that evolve their plasticity, evolvability and niche-constructing behaviors.

item.title: The Weighted Möbius Score: A Unified Framework for Feature Attribution
item.description: Feature attribution aims to explain the reasoning behind a black-box model's prediction by identifying the impact of each feature on the prediction.

item.title: GIFT: Graph-Induced Fine-Tuning for Multi-Party Conversation Understanding
item.description: Addressing the issues of who saying what to whom in multi-party conversations (MPCs) has recently attracted a lot of research attention.

item.title: Pre-Training to Learn in Context
item.description: In-context learning, where pre-trained language models learn to perform tasks from task examples and instructions in their contexts, has attracted much attention in the NLP community.

item.title: Graph Reinforcement Learning for Network Control via Bi-Level Optimization
item.description: Optimization problems over dynamic networks have been extensively studied and widely used in the past decades to formulate numerous real-world problems.

item.title: Tailoring Instructions to Student's Learning Levels Boosts Knowledge Distillation
item.description: It has been commonly observed that a teacher model with superior performance does not necessarily result in a stronger student, highlighting a discrepancy between current teacher training practices and effective knowledge transfer.

item.title: SuperDialseg: A Large-scale Dataset for Supervised Dialogue Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we provide a feasible definition of dialogue segmentation points with the help of document-grounded dialogues and release a large-scale supervised dataset called SuperDialseg, containing 9K dialogues based on two prevalent document-grounded dialogue corpora, and also inherit their useful dialogue-related annotations.

item.title: Unsupervised Sentence Representation Learning with Frequency-induced Adversarial Tuning and Incomplete Sentence Filtering
item.description: To solve the problems, we fine-tune PLMs by leveraging the frequency information of words and propose a novel USRL framework, namely Sentence Representation Learning with Frequency-induced Adversarial tuning and Incomplete sentence filtering (SLT-FAI).

item.title: An Ensemble Approach for Automated Theorem Proving Based on Efficient Name Invariant Graph Neural Representations
item.description: NIAGRA addresses this problem by using 1) improved Graph Neural Networks for learning name-invariant formula representations that is tailored for their unique characteristics and 2) an efficient ensemble approach for automated theorem proving.

item.title: MV-Map: Offboard HD-Map Generation with Multi-view Consistency
item.description: To further enhance multi-view consistency, we augment the uncertainty network with the global 3D structure optimized by a voxelized neural radiance field (Voxel-NeRF).

item.title: CQE: A Comprehensive Quantity Extractor
item.description: Compared to other information extraction approaches, interestingly only a few works exist that describe methods for a proper extraction and representation of quantities in text.

item.title: Measuring Consistency in Text-based Financial Forecasting Models
item.description: Using FinTrust, we show that the consistency of state-of-the-art NLP models for financial forecasting is poor.

item.title: RL4F: Generating Natural Language Feedback with Reinforcement Learning for Repairing Model Outputs
item.description: Despite their unprecedented success, even the largest language models make mistakes.

item.title: Mode Approximation Makes Good Vision-Language Prompts
item.description: With the advance of large-scale model technologies, parameter-efficient transfer learning (PETL) has swept across various fields of Artificial Intelligence.

item.title: Unsupervised Semantic Variation Prediction using the Distribution of Sibling Embeddings
item.description: However, some of the previously associated meanings of a target word can become obsolete over time (e. g. meaning of gay as happy), while novel usages of existing words are observed (e. g. meaning of cell as a mobile phone).

item.title: Legal Extractive Summarization of U.S. Court Opinions
item.description: This paper tackles the task of legal extractive summarization using a dataset of 430K U. S. court opinions with key passages annotated.

item.title: EMBRACE: Evaluation and Modifications for Boosting RACE
item.description: When training and evaluating machine reading comprehension models, it is very important to work with high-quality datasets that are also representative of real-world reading comprehension tasks.

item.title: A Reproducible Extraction of Training Images from Diffusion Models
item.description: We release code to verify our extraction attack, perform the attack, as well as all extracted prompts at \url{https://github. com/ryanwebster90/onestep-extraction}.

item.title: Inverse Rendering of Translucent Objects using Physical and Neural Renderers
item.description: To enhance the supervision of the proposed neural renderer, we also propose an augmented loss.

item.title: MIMEx: Intrinsic Rewards from Masked Input Modeling
item.description: We show how this perspective naturally leads to a unified view on existing intrinsic reward approaches: they are special cases of conditional prediction, where the estimation of novelty can be seen as pseudo-likelihood estimation with different mask distributions.

item.title: Five A$^{+}$ Network: You Only Need 9K Parameters for Underwater Image Enhancement
item.description: In this work, we propose the Five A$^{+}$ Network (FA$^{+}$Net), a highly efficient and lightweight real-time underwater image enhancement network with only $\sim$ 9k parameters and $\sim$ 0. 01s processing time.

item.title: Denoising Diffusion Models for Plug-and-Play Image Restoration
item.description: Although diffusion models have shown impressive performance for high-quality image synthesis, their potential to serve as a generative denoiser prior to the plug-and-play IR methods remains to be further explored.

item.title: Learning Better Contrastive View from Radiologist's Gaze
item.description: Then, we propose a novel augmentation method, i. e., FocusContrast, to learn from radiologists' gaze in diagnosis and generate contrastive views for medical images with guidance from radiologists' visual attention.
